   21: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   22: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, [batch]).
   23: %%
   24: %% Run a specific group:
   25: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   26: %%
   27: %% Run a specific test case:
   28: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   29: %%
   30: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   31: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   32: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   33: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   34: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}]) end.
   35: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   36: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   37: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   38: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   39: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   40: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   41: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   42: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {group, inet_backend_socket}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   43: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   44: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   45: %%
   46: %%
   47: %%

  122: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  123:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  124:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  125:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  126:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  127:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  128:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  129: 
  130:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  131: 
  132:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  133:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  134:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  135:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  136:     Config.
  137: 
  138: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  139:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  140:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  141:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  142:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  143:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  144:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  145: 
  146:     SysEvs = kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
  147: 
  148:     ?P("system events during test: "
  149:        "~n   ~p", [SysEvs]),
  150: 
  151:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  152:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  153:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  154:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: suite() ->
  158:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  159:      {timetrap,{minutes,4}}].
  160: 
  161: all() ->
  162:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
  163:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
  164:     %% applications on *all* machines.
  165:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
  166:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
  167:         true ->
  168:             [
  169:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  170:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
  171:              {group, inet_backend_socket},
  172:              {group, tickets}
  173:             ];
  174:         _ ->
  175:             [
  176:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  177:              {group, tickets}
  178:             ]
  179:     end.
  180:

  358: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  359: 
  360:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  361:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  362:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  363: 
  364:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  365:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  366:             SKIP;
  367: 
  368:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  369:             
  370:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  371:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  372:             
  373:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  374:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  375: 
  376:             Config1
  377:     end.
  378: 
  379: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  380: 
  381:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  382:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  383:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  384: 
  385:     %% Stop the local monitor
  386:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  387: 
  388:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  389: 
  390:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  391:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  392: 
  393:     Config1.
  394: 
  395: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  396:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  397: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  398:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  399:         true ->
  400:             %% The environment trumps us,
  401:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  402:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  403:         false ->
  404:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  405:     end;
  406: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  407:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  408:         true ->
  409:             %% The environment trumps us,
  410:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  411:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  412:         false ->
  413:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  414:     end;
  415: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  416:     Config.
  417: 
  418: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  419:     Config.
  420: 
  421: 
  422: %% Tests kernel application variables inet_default_listen_options and
  423: %% inet_default_connect_options.
  424: default_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  425:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  426:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  427:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  428:                             Addr;
  429:                         {error, Reason} ->
  430:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  431:                     end
  432:            end,
  433:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_default_options(Config, Addr) end,
  434:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  435:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  436: 
  437: do_default_options(Config, Addr) ->
  438:     %% First check the delay_send option
  439:     {true,  true,  true}  = do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr),
  440:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr),
  441:     {true,  false, false} = do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr),
  442:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr),
  443:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr),
  444:     {false, true,  true}  = do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr),
  445:     %% Now lets start some nodes with different combinations of options:
  446:     {true,true,true} =
  447:         do_delay_on_other_node("", fun() -> do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr) end),
  448:     {true,false,false} =
  449: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  450: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  451: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  452:     
  453:     {false,true,true} =
  454: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  455: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  456: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  457:     
  458:     {true,true,true} =
  459: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  460: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  461: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr) end),
  462:     {true,true,true} =
  463: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  464: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  465: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr) end),
  466:     {false,false,false} =
  467: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  468: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  469: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) end),
  470:     {false,true,true} =
  471: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  472: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\" "
  473: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  474: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  475: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) end),
  476:     {true,false,false} =
  477: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  478: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\" "
  479: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  480: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  481: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr) end),
  482:     {true,true,true} =
  483: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  484: 			       "\"{delay_send,true}\" "
  485: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  486: 			       "\"{delay_send,true}\"",
  487: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  488:     %% Active is to dangerous and is suppressed
  489:     {true,true,true} =
  490: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  491: 			       "\"{active,false}\" "
  492: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  493: 			       "\"{active,false}\"",
  494: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) end),
  495:     {true,true,true} =
  496: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  497: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\" "
  498: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  499: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\"",
  500: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) end),
  501:     {true,true,true} =
  502: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  503: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\" "
  504: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  505: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\"",
  506: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  507:     ok.
  508: 
  509: 
  510: do_delay_on_other_node(XArgs, Function) ->
  511:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  512:     {ok, Node} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME,
  513:                              "-pa " ++ Dir ++ " " ++ XArgs),
  514:     Res = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Function,[]]),
  515:     ?STOP_NODE(Node),
  516:     Res.
  517: 
  518: do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr) ->
  519:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  520:     {ok, {_,PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  521:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]) of
  522:             {ok, Sock} ->
  523:                 Sock;
  524:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
  525:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
  526:         end,
  527:     {ok,S2}= gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  528:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  529:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  530:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  531:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  532:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  533:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  534:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  535: 
  536: do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) ->
  537:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  538:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  539:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  540:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  541:     {ok, [{delay_send,B1}]} = inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  542:     {ok, [{delay_send,B2}]} = inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  543:     {ok, [{delay_send,B3}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  544:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  545:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  546:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  547:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  548: 
  549: do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr) ->
  550:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  551:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  552:     {ok,S} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  553:     {ok,S2}= gen_tcp:accept(LS),

  556:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  557:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  558:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  559:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  560:     {B1,B2,B3}.

  601: do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) ->
  602:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  603:     {ok,{_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  604:     {ok,S}   = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  605:     {ok,S2}  = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  606:     {ok,[{active,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[active]),
  607:     {ok,[{active,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[active]),
  608:     {ok,[{active,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[active]),
  609:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  610:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  611:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  612:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  613: 
  614: %% Open a listen port and change controlling_process for it
  615: %% The result should be ok of done by the owner process,
  616: %% Otherwise is should return {error,not_owner} or similar.
  617: controlling_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  618:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  619:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  620:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  621:                             Addr;
  622:                         {error, Reason} ->
  623:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  624:                     end
  625:            end,
  626:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_controlling_process(Config, Addr) end,
  627:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  628:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  629: 
  630: do_controlling_process(Config, Addr) ->
  631:     ?P("create listen socket with:"
  632:        "~n   Addr: ~p", [Addr]),
  633:     {ok, S} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  634:     Pid2    = spawn(?MODULE, not_owner, [S]),
  635:     Pid2 ! {self(),2,control},
  636:     {error, E} = receive {2,_E} ->
  637: 			      _E
  638: 		      after 10000 -> timeout
  639: 		      end,
  640:     io:format("received ~p~n",[E]),
  641:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE,not_owner,[S]),
  642:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(S,Pid),
  643:     Pid ! {self(),1,control},
  644:     ok = receive {1,ok} ->
  645:                      ok
  646:          after 1000 -> timeout
  647:          end,
  648:     Pid ! close.
  649: 
  650: not_owner(S) ->
  651:     receive
  652: 	{From,Tag,control} ->
  653: 	    From ! {Tag,gen_tcp:controlling_process(S,self())};
  654: 	close ->
  655: 	    gen_tcp:close(S)
  656:     after 1000 ->
  657: 	    ok
  658:     end.
  659: 
  660: %% Open a listen port and assign the controlling process to
  661: %% it self, then exit and make sure the port is closed properly.
  662: controlling_process_self(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  663:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  664:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  665:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  666:                             Addr;
  667:                         {error, Reason} ->
  668:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  669:                     end
  670:            end,
  671:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_controlling_process_self(Config, Addr) end,
  672:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  673:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  674: 
  675: do_controlling_process_self(Config, Addr) ->
  676:     S = self(),
  677:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
  678:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  679: 		       {ok,Sock} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  680: 		       S ! {socket, Sock},
  681: 		       ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(Sock,self()),
  682: 		       S ! done
  683: 	       end),
  684:     receive
  685: 	done ->
  686: 	    receive
  687: 		{socket,Sock} ->
  688: 		    process_flag(trap_exit,false),
  689: 		    %% Make sure the port is invalid after process crash
  690:                     receive after 500 -> ok end,
  691:                     case inet:port(Sock) of
  692:                         {error,einval} -> ok;
  693:                         {error,closed} -> ok % XXX gen_tcp_socket
  694:                     end
  695: 
  696: 	    end;
  697: 	Msg when element(1,Msg) /= socket ->
  698: 	    process_flag(trap_exit,false),
  699: 	    exit({unknown_msg,Msg})
  700:     end.
  701:     
  702: 
  703: %% Open a listen port and connect to it, then close the listen port
  704: %% without doing any accept.  The connected socket should receive
  705: %% a tcp_closed message.
  706: no_accept(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  707:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  708:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  709:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  710:                             Addr;
  711:                         {error, Reason} ->
  712:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  713:                     end
  714:            end,
  715:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_no_access(Config, Addr) end,
  716:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  717:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  718: 
  719: do_no_access(Config, Addr) ->
  720:     ?P("create listen socket with Addr: ~p", [Addr]),
  721:     %% LOpts = [{debug, true}],
  722:     LOpts = [],
  723:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr} | LOpts]),
  724:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  725:     ?P("create connection socket"),
  726:     %% COpts = [{debug, true}],
  727:     COpts = [],
  728:     ?P("connect to"
  729:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
  730:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Addr, Port]),
  731:     {ok, Client}    = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr} | COpts]),
  732:     ?P("close listen socket"),
  733:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
  734:     ?P("await connection socket closed"),
  735:     receive
  736:         {tcp_closed, Client} ->
  737:             ?P("connection socket closed message received => OK"),
  738:             ok
  739:     after 5000 ->
  740:             ?P("connection socket closed message *not* received => FAIL"),
  741:             ct:fail(never_closed)    
  742:     end.
  743: 
  744: %% Send several packets to a socket and close it.  All packets should
  745: %% arrive to the other end.
  746: close_with_pending_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  747:     ?P("~w -> entry with"
  748:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  749:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, nodes()]),
  750:     Pre = fun() ->
  751:                   ?P("~w:pre -> try start node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  752:                   case start_remote_node(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  753: 					 ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config)) of
  754:                       {ok, Node} ->
  755:                           ?P("~w:pre -> node ~p started",
  756:                              [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  757:                           Node;
  758:                       {error, {no_connection,timeout}} ->
  759:                           ?P("~w:pre -> [ERROR] no connection : timeout",
  760:                              [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  761:                           ?SKIPT("node start timeout");
  762:                       {error, Other} ->
  763:                           %% Node starting is not what this test case is about.
  764:                           %% so, if this fails, skip
  765:                           ?P("~w:pre -> [ERROR] Unexpected error:"
  766:                              "~n      ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Other]),
  767:                           ?SKIPT({failed_starting_remote_node, Other})
  768:                   end
  769:           end,
  770:     TC   = fun(Node) ->
  771:                    do_close_with_pending_output(Node, Config)
  772:            end,
  773:     Post = fun(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
  774:                    ?P("~w:post -> try stop 'remote' node ~p",
  775:                       [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  776:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)   
  777:            end,
  778:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, TC, Post).
  779: 
  780: do_close_with_pending_output(Node, Config) ->
  781:     {ok, Addr}      = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
  782:     ?P("~w -> try create listen socket", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  783:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
  784:     ?P("~w -> try get port", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  785:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  786:     Packets         = 16,
  787:     Total           = 2048*Packets,
  788: 
  789:     Self = self(),
  790: 
  791:     ?P("~w -> try spawn sender (on ~p): "
  792:        "~n   Config:  ~p"
  793:        "~n   Addr:    ~p"
  794:        "~n   Port:    ~p"
  795:        "~n   packets: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node, Config, Addr, Port, Packets]),
  796:     Sender = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, sender,
  797: 			[Config, Self, Addr, Port, Packets]),
  798:     ?P("~w -> sender spawned (~p) - spawn reader",
  799:        [?FUNCTION_NAME, Sender]),
  800:     Reader = spawn_link(
  801: 	       fun() ->
  802: 		       Self ! {self(), "Starting - try accept"},
  803: 		       {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  804: 		       ?P("~w -> connection accepted - recv ~w data",
  805: 			  [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total]),
  806: 		       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, true}]),    
  807: 		       Self ! {self(), "Accepted - try read"},
  808: 		       case gen_tcp:recv(A, Total) of
  809: 			   {ok, Bin} when (byte_size(Bin) =:= Total) ->
  810: 			       ?P("~w -> [OK] received expected ~w "
  811: 				  "bytes of data - "
  812: 				  "close sockets", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total]),
  813: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  814: 			       Self ! {self(), "read - expected amount of data - close socket(s)"},
  815: 			       gen_tcp:close(A),
  816: 			       gen_tcp:close(L),
  817: 			       ?P("~w -> [OK] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  818: 			       exit(ok);
  819: 			   {ok, Bin} ->
  820: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] unexpected amount "
  821: 				  "of data recv - "
  822: 				  "close sockets: "
  823: 				  "~n      Expected: ~p"
  824: 				  "~n      Received: ~p",
  825: 				  [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total, byte_size(Bin)]),
  826: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  827: 			       Self ! {self(), "read - *unexpected* amount of data - close socket(s)"},
  828: 			       gen_tcp:close(A),
  829: 			       gen_tcp:close(L),
  830: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  831: 			       ct:fail({small_packet, byte_size(Bin)});
  832: 			   Error ->
  833: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] recv failed - "
  834: 				  "close sockets: "
  835: 				  "~n      Error: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Error]),
  836: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  837: 			       Self ! {self(), ?P("read failed - ~p - close socket(s)", [Error])},
  838: 			       (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
  839: 			       (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
  840: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  841: 			       ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
  842: 		       end
  843: 	       end
  844: 	      ),
  845:     await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader).
  846: 
  847: 
  848: await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader) ->
  849:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  850:     do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader).
  851: 
  852: do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader) ->
  853:     receive
  854: 	{'EXIT', Reader, ok} ->
  855: 	    ?P("reader terminated with success"),
  856: 	    ok;
  857: 	{'EXIT', Reader, RError} ->
  858: 	    ?P("reader terminated with failure: "
  859: 	       "~n   ~p", [RError]),
  860: 	    ct:fail({reader, RError});
  861: 
  862: 	{'EXIT', Sender, ok} ->
  863: 	    ?P("sender terminated with success"),
  864: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, undefined, Reader);
  865: 	{'EXIT', Sender, SError} ->
  866: 	    ?P("sender terminated with failure: "
  867: 	       "~n   ~p", [SError]),
  868: 	    ct:fail({sender, SError});
  869: 
  870: 	{nodedown, Node} = NODEDOWN ->
  871: 	    ?P("sender node down"),
  872: 	    ct:fail(NODEDOWN);
  873: 
  874: 	{Sender, Msg} ->
  875: 	    ?P("sender: ~s~n", [Msg]),
  876: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader);
  877: 
  878: 	{Reader, Msg} ->
  879: 	    ?P("reader: ~s~n", [Msg]),
  880: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader)
  881:     end.
  882: 
  883: sender(Config, Parent, ServerAddr, ServerPort, Packets) ->
  884:     Parent ! {self(), "starting - get local address"},
  885:     case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  886: 	{ok, LocalAddr} ->
  887: 	    Parent ! {self(), ?P("got local address ~p", [LocalAddr])},
  888: 	    X256 = lists:seq(0, 255),
  889: 	    X512 = [X256|X256],
  890: 	    X1K = [X512|X512],
  891: 	    Bin = list_to_binary([X1K|X1K]),
  892: 	    Parent ! {self(), "try connect to server"},
  893: 	    {ok, Sock} = ?CONNECT(Config, ServerAddr, ServerPort,
  894: 				  [{ip, LocalAddr}]),
  895: 	    Parent ! {self(), "connected - begin sending"},
  896: 	    send_loop(Sock, Bin, Packets),
  897: 	    Parent ! {self(), "sent - close socket"},
  898: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
  899: 	    Parent ! {self(), "done"},
  900: 	    exit(ok);
  901: 	Else ->
  902: 	    exit({skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Else])})
  903:     end.
  904: 
  905: send_loop(_Sock, _Data, 0) -> ok;
  906: send_loop(Sock, Data, Left) ->
  907:     %% ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
  908:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data) of
  909: 	ok ->
  910: 	    ok;
  911:         {error, Reason} ->
  912:             ?P("[send_loop] failed send data when:"
  913: 	       "~n   Left:        ~p"
  914: 	       "~n   Reason:      ~p"
  915: 	       "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Left, Reason, (catch inet:info(Sock))]),
  916:             exit({failed_send, Left, Reason})
  917:     end,
  918:     send_loop(Sock, Data, Left-1).
  919: 
  920: %% Test {active,N} option
  921: %% Verify operation of the {active,N} option.
  922: active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  923:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  924:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  925:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  926:                             Addr;
  927:                         {error, Reason} ->
  928:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  929:                     end
  930:            end,
  931:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_active_n(Config, Addr) end,
  932:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  933:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  934: 
  935: do_active_n(Config, Addr) ->
  936:     N = 3,
  937:     LS = ok(?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active,N}, {ip, Addr}])),
  938:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  939:     %% ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-N}]),
  940:     %% The point of this is to "demonstrate" that its possible to 
  941:     %% enable and then later disable debug in one (setopts) call!
  942:     %% Note the order! Its reversed!!
  943:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{debug, false}, {active,-N}, {debug, true}]),
  944:     receive
  945:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  946:     after
  947:         5000 ->
  948:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  949:     end,
  950:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  951:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,0}]),
  952:     receive
  953:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  954:     after
  955:         5000 ->
  956:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  957:     end,
  958:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,32767}]),
  959:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,1}]),
  960:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-32769}]),
  961:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-32768}]),
  962:     receive
  963:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  964:     after
  965:         5000 ->
  966:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  967:     end,
  968:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  969:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,N}]),
  970:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,true}]),
  971:     [{active,true}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  972:     receive
  973:         _ -> exit({error,active_n})
  974:     after
  975:         0 ->
  976:             ok
  977:     end,
  978:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,N}]),
  979:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,once}]),
  980:     [{active,once}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  981:     receive
  982:         _ -> exit({error,active_n})
  983:     after
  984:         0 ->
  985:             ok
  986:     end,
  987:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,32768}]),
  988:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,false}]),
  989:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  990:     Port = ok(inet:port(LS)),
  991:     C = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active,N}, {ip, Addr}]) of
  992:             {ok, CS} ->
  993:                 CS;
  994:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
  995:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
  996:         end,
  997:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(C, [active])),
  998:     S = ok(gen_tcp:accept(LS)),
  999:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,N}]),
 1000:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S, [active])),
 1001:     repeat(3,
 1002:            fun(I) ->
 1003:                    Msg = "message "++integer_to_list(I),
 1004:                    ok = gen_tcp:send(C, Msg),
 1005:                    receive
 1006:                        {tcp,S,Msg} ->
 1007:                            ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Msg)
 1008:                    after
 1009:                        5000 ->
 1010:                            exit({error,timeout})
 1011:                    end,
 1012:                    receive
 1013:                        {tcp,C,Msg} ->
 1014:                            ok
 1015:                    after
 1016:                        5000 ->
 1017:                            exit({error,timeout})
 1018:                    end
 1019:            end),
 1020:     receive
 1021:         {tcp_passive,S} ->
 1022:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S, [active]))
 1023:     after
 1024:         5000 ->
 1025:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1026:     end,
 1027:     receive
 1028:         {tcp_passive,C} ->
 1029:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(C, [active]))
 1030:     after
 1031:         5000 ->
 1032:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1033:     end,
 1034:     LS2 = ok(?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,0}])),
 1035:     receive
 1036:         {tcp_passive,LS2} ->
 1037:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS2, [active]))
 1038:     after
 1039:         5000 ->
 1040:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1041:     end,
 1042:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS2),
 1043:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C),
 1044:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 1045:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS),
 1046:     ok.
 1047: 
 1048: -define(OTP_3924_MAX_DELAY,  100).
 1049: -define(OTP_3924_MIN_FACTOR, 4).
 1050: %% Taken out of the blue, but on intra host connections
 1051: %% I expect propagation of a close to be quite fast
 1052: %% so 100 ms seems reasonable.
 1053: 
 1054: %% Tests that a socket can be closed fast enough.
 1055: otp_3924(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1056:     ?P("~w -> entry with"
 1057:        "~n      Config: ~p"
 1058:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, nodes()]),
 1059:     Cond = fun() ->
 1060:                    case lists:keysearch(kernel_factor, 1, Config) of
 1061:                        %% Only run this on machines that are "fast enough"...
 1062:                        {value, {kernel_factor, Factor}}
 1063:                          when (Factor =< ?OTP_3924_MIN_FACTOR) ->
 1064:                            ?P("~w:condition -> "
 1065:                               "*fast* enough (~w)", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Factor]),
 1066:                            ok;
 1067:                        _ ->
 1068:                            ?P("~w:condition -> "
 1069:                               "*not* fast enough", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1070:                            {skip, "Too slow for this test"}
 1071:                    end
 1072:            end,
 1073:     Pre = fun() ->
 1074:                   ?P("~w:pre -> which local address", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1075: 		  Addr = case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1076: 			     {ok, A} ->
 1077: 				 A;
 1078: 			     {error, Reason} ->
 1079: 				 throw({skip, Reason})
 1080: 			 end,
 1081:                   ?P("~w:pre -> calculate max delay", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1082:                   MaxDelay = (case has_superfluous_schedulers() of
 1083:                                   true -> 4;
 1084:                                   false -> 1
 1085:                               end
 1086:                               * case {erlang:system_info(debug_compiled),
 1087:                                       erlang:system_info(lock_checking)} of
 1088:                                     {true, _} -> 6;
 1089:                                     {_, true} -> 2;
 1090:                                     _ -> 1
 1091:                                 end * ?OTP_3924_MAX_DELAY),
 1092:                   ?P("~w:pre -> try start node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1093:                   {ok, Node} = start_node(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME),
 1094:                   ?P("~w:pre -> done with: "
 1095:                      "~n      Node:     ~p"
 1096:                      "~n      MaxDelay: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node, MaxDelay]),
 1097:                   #{addr      => Addr,
 1098: 		    node      => Node,
 1099: 		    max_delay => MaxDelay}
 1100:           end,
 1101:     TC  = fun(#{addr      := Addr,
 1102: 		node      := Node,
 1103: 		max_delay := MaxDelay}) ->
 1104:                   ?P("~w:tc -> begin", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1105:                   Res = do_otp_3924(Config, Addr, Node, MaxDelay),
 1106:                   ?P("~w:tc -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1107:                   Res
 1108:           end,
 1109:     Post = fun({Node, _}) ->
 1110:                    ?P("~w:post -> try stop node ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
 1111:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 1112:            end,
 1113:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1114: 
 1115: do_otp_3924(Config, Addr, Node, MaxDelay) ->
 1116:     DataLen = 100*1024,
 1117:     Data    = otp_3924_data(DataLen),
 1118:     %% Repeat the test a couple of times to prevent the test from passing
 1119:     %% by chance.
 1120:     repeat(10, fun(N) ->
 1121:                        ok = otp_3924(Config, Addr, MaxDelay, Node, Data, DataLen, N)
 1122:                end),
 1123:     ok.
 1124: 
 1125: otp_3924(Config, Addr, MaxDelay, Node, Data, DataLen, N) ->
 1126:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [list, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
 1127:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1128:     Sender          = spawn_link(Node,
 1129: 				 ?MODULE,
 1130: 				 otp_3924_sender,
 1131: 				 [Config, self(), Addr, Port, Data]),
 1132:     Data = otp_3924_receive_data(L, Sender, MaxDelay, DataLen, N),
 1133:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1134: 
 1135: otp_3924_receive_data(LSock, Sender, MaxDelay, Len, N) ->
 1136:     OP = process_flag(priority, max),
 1137:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1138:     TimeoutRef = make_ref(),
 1139:     Data = (catch begin
 1140:                       Sender ! start,
 1141:                       {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 1142:                       D = otp_3924_receive_data(Sock,
 1143:                                                 TimeoutRef,
 1144:                                                 MaxDelay,
 1145:                                                 Len,
 1146:                                                 [],
 1147:                                                 0),
 1148:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1149:                       D
 1150:                   end),
 1151:     unlink(Sender),
 1152:     process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1153:     process_flag(priority, OP),
 1154:     receive
 1155: 	{'EXIT', _, TimeoutRef} ->
 1156: 	    ct:fail({close_not_fast_enough,MaxDelay,N});
 1157: 	{'EXIT', Sender, Reason} ->
 1158: 	    ct:fail({sender_exited, Reason});
 1159: 	{'EXIT', _Other, Reason} ->
 1160: 	    ct:fail({linked_process_exited, Reason})
 1161:     after 0 ->
 1162: 	    case Data of
 1163: 		{'EXIT', {A,B}} ->
 1164: 		    ct:fail({A,B,N});
 1165: 		{'EXIT', Failure} ->
 1166: 		    ct:fail(Failure);
 1167: 		_ ->
 1168: 		    Data
 1169: 	    end
 1170:     end.
 1171:     
 1172: 
 1173: otp_3924_receive_data(Sock, TimeoutRef, MaxDelay, Len, Acc, AccLen) ->
 1174:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0) of
 1175: 	{ok, Data} ->
 1176: 	    NewAccLen = AccLen + length(Data),
 1177: 	    if
 1178: 		NewAccLen == Len ->
 1179: 		    {ok, TRef} = timer:exit_after(MaxDelay,
 1180:                                                   self(),
 1181:                                                   TimeoutRef),
 1182: 		    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
 1183: 		    timer:cancel(TRef),
 1184: 		    lists:flatten([Acc, Data]);
 1185: 		NewAccLen > Len ->
 1186: 		    exit({received_too_much, NewAccLen});
 1187: 		true ->
 1188: 		    otp_3924_receive_data(Sock,
 1189: 					  TimeoutRef,
 1190: 					  MaxDelay,
 1191: 					  Len,
 1192: 					  [Acc, Data],
 1193: 					  NewAccLen)
 1194: 	    end;
 1195: 	{error, closed} ->
 1196: 	    exit({premature_close, AccLen});
 1197: 	Error ->
 1198: 	    exit({unexpected_error, Error})
 1199:     end.
 1200:     
 1201: otp_3924_data(Size) ->
 1202:     Block =
 1203: 	"This is a sequence of characters that will be repeated "
 1204: 	"again and again and again and again and again and ...  ",
 1205:     L = length(Block), 
 1206:     otp_3924_data(Block, [], Size div L, Size rem L).
 1207: 
 1208: otp_3924_data(_, Acc, 0, 0) ->
 1209:     lists:flatten(Acc);
 1210: otp_3924_data(_, Acc, 0, SingleLeft) ->
 1211:     otp_3924_data(false, ["."|Acc], 0, SingleLeft-1);
 1212: otp_3924_data(Block, Acc, BlockLeft, SingleLeft) ->
 1213:     otp_3924_data(Block, [Block|Acc], BlockLeft-1, SingleLeft).
 1214: 
 1215: otp_3924_sender(Config, Receiver, Addr, Port, Data) ->
 1216:     receive
 1217: 	start ->
 1218: 	    %% {ok, Sock} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [list, {ip, Addr}]),
 1219: 	    case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [list, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1220: 		{ok, Sock} ->
 1221: 		    gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
 1222: 		    ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1223: 		    unlink(Receiver);
 1224: 		{error, eaddrinuse = Reason} ->
 1225: 		    exit({skip, Reason})
 1226: 	    end
 1227:     end.
 1228: 
 1229: 
 1230: %% Tests that a huge amount of data can be received before a close.
 1231: data_before_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1232:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1233:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1234:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1235:                             Addr;
 1236:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1237:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1238:                     end
 1239:            end,
 1240:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_data_before_close(Config, Addr) end,
 1241:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1242:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1243: 
 1244: do_data_before_close(Config, Addr) ->
 1245:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 1246:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}]),
 1247:     {ok, {_, TcpPort}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1248:     Bytes = 256*1024,
 1249:     ?P("create 'huge sender' process"),
 1250:     spawn_link(fun() -> huge_sender(Config, Addr, TcpPort, Bytes) end),
 1251:     ?P("accept connection"),
 1252:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1253:     ?P("receive and count data"),
 1254:     case count_bytes_recv(A, 0) of
 1255:         {Bytes, Result} ->
 1256:             ?P("Success: "
 1257:                "~n   Result: ~p", [Result]);
 1258:         {Wrong, Result} ->
 1259:             ?P("Wrong Number of Bytes:"
 1260:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1261:                "~n   Got:      ~p"
 1262:                "~n   Result:   ~p", [Bytes, Wrong, Result]),
 1263:             ct:fail({wrong_count, Wrong})
 1264:     end,
 1265:     ok.
 1266: 
 1267: count_bytes_recv(Sock, Total) ->
 1268:     receive
 1269: 	{tcp, Sock, Bin} ->
 1270:             Sz = byte_size(Bin),
 1271:             ?P("count_bytes_recv -> received ~w bytes of data", [Sz]),
 1272: 	    count_bytes_recv(Sock, Total+Sz);
 1273: 	Other ->
 1274:             ?P("count_bytes_recv -> received 'other': "
 1275:                "~n   ~p", [Other]),
 1276: 	    {Total, Other}
 1277:     end.
 1278: 
 1279: huge_sender(Config, Addr, TcpPort, Bytes) ->
 1280:     ?P("huge_sender -> connect to"
 1281:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1282:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Addr, TcpPort]),
 1283:     %% {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, TcpPort, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1284:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, TcpPort, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1285: 	{ok, Client} ->
 1286: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> connected: sleep some"),
 1287: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1288: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> try send ~w bytes", [Bytes]),
 1289: 	    ok = gen_tcp:send(Client, make_zero_packet(Bytes)),
 1290: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> data sent: sleep some"),
 1291: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1292: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> close socket"),
 1293: 	    _ = gen_tcp:close(Client),
 1294: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> done"),
 1295: 	    ok;
 1296: 	{error, Reason} when (Reason =:= duplicate_name) ->
 1297: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> connect failed: "
 1298: 	       "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 1299: 	    exit({skip, ?F("connect failed: ~p", [Reason])})
 1300:     end.
 1301: 
 1302: make_zero_packet(0) -> [];
 1303: make_zero_packet(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
 1304:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
 1305:     [P|P];
 1306: make_zero_packet(N) ->
 1307:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
 1308:     [0, P|P].
 1309: 
 1310: %% OTP-2924. Test that the socket process does not crash when
 1311: %% sys:get_status(Pid) is called.
 1312: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1313:     {ok,{socket,Pid,_,_}} = ?LISTEN(Config, 5678,[]),
 1314:     {status,Pid,_,_} = sys:get_status(Pid).
 1315: 
 1316: -define(RECOVER_SLEEP, 60000).
 1317: -define(RETRY_SLEEP,   15000).
 1318: 
 1319: %% Open as many sockets as possible. Do this several times and check
 1320: %% that we get the same number of sockets every time.
 1321: %% Guess: This is "supposed to" test for socket leakage
 1322: %% This works badly with the socket inet_backend, so make
 1323: %% some "checks" and "adjustments"...
 1324: iter_max_socks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1325:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(30)),
 1326:     Cond = fun() -> iter_max_socks_condition(Config) end,
 1327:     Pre  = fun() ->
 1328:                    %% This is not *nearly* enough
 1329:                    %% We have some crap machines,
 1330:                    %% which we need to "handle with care"...
 1331:                    Tries =
 1332:                        case os:type() of
 1333:                            {win32, _} ->
 1334: 			       7;
 1335:                            {unix, darwin} ->
 1336:                                10;
 1337:                            _ ->
 1338:                                20
 1339:                        end,
 1340:                    %% Run on a different node in order to
 1341:                    %% limit the effect if this test fails.
 1342:                    Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1343:                    {ok, Node} = ?START_NODE(test_iter_max_socks,
 1344:                                             "+Q 2048 -pa " ++ Dir),
 1345:                    {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 1346:                    #{addr  => Addr,
 1347:                      tries => Tries,
 1348:                      node  => Node}
 1349:            end,
 1350:     Case = fun(#{addr  := Addr,
 1351:                  tries := Tries,
 1352:                  node  := Node}) ->
 1353:                    do_iter_max_socks(Config, Addr, Tries, Node)
 1354:            end,
 1355:     Post = fun(#{node := Node}) ->
 1356:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 1357:            end,
 1358:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 1359: 
 1360: -define(IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, 4096).
 1361: 
 1362: iter_max_socks_condition(Config) -> 
 1363:     case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 1364:         true ->
 1365:             case os:type() of
 1366:                 {unix, _} ->
 1367:                     MaxNumOpenFilesStr =
 1368:                         string:trim(os:cmd("ulimit -n")),
 1369:                     try list_to_integer(MaxNumOpenFilesStr) of
 1370:                         MaxNumOpenFile when
 1371:                               (MaxNumOpenFile =< ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT) ->
 1372:                             ok;
 1373:                         MaxNumOpenFile ->
 1374:                             {skip, ?F("ulimit -n: ~w (> ~w)",
 1375:                                       [MaxNumOpenFile, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT])}
 1376:                     catch
 1377:                         _:_:_ ->
 1378:                             %% Skip just to be on the safe side
 1379:                             {skip, "Works badly with the socket inet_backend"}
 1380:                     end;
 1381:                 _ ->
 1382:                     ok
 1383:             end;
 1384:         false ->
 1385:             ok
 1386:     end.
 1387: 
 1388:    
 1389: do_iter_max_socks(Config, Addr, Tries, Node) ->
 1390:     Self = self(),
 1391:     L = iter_max_socks_run(
 1392:           Node,
 1393:           fun() ->
 1394:                   exit(iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Self, Tries, initialize))
 1395:           end),
 1396:     ?P("Result: "
 1397:        "~n   ~p", [L]),
 1398:     all_equal(L),
 1399:     {comment, "Max sockets: " ++ integer_to_list(hd(L))}.
 1400: 
 1401: iter_max_socks_run(Node, F) ->
 1402:     try erlang:spawn_opt(Node, F, [monitor]) of
 1403:         {Pid, MRef} when is_pid(Pid) andalso is_reference(MRef) ->
 1404:             iter_max_socks_await_runner(Node, Pid, MRef);
 1405:         _Any ->
 1406:             ?P("Unexpected process start result: "
 1407:                "~n   ~p", [_Any]),
 1408:             {skip, "Failed starting iterator (remote) process"}
 1409:     catch
 1410:         C:E:S ->
 1411:             ?P("Failed starting iterator (remote) process: "
 1412:                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1413:                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1414:                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1415:             {skip, "Failed starting iterator (remote) process"}
 1416:     end.
 1417: 
 1418: iter_max_socks_await_runner(Node, Pid, MRef) ->
 1419:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 1420:     Start = millis(),
 1421:     iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Start).
 1422: 
 1423: iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp) ->
 1424:     receive
 1425:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Res} ->
 1426:             T = millis(),
 1427:             ?P("received runner result after ~w ms "
 1428:                  "(~w ms since last status)", [T - Start, T - Timestamp]),
 1429:             erlang:monitor_node(Node, false),
 1430:             Res;
 1431: 
 1432:         {nodedown, Node} = NODEDOWN ->
 1433:             ?P("Received unexpected ~p 'nodedown'", [Node]),
 1434:             NODEDOWN;
 1435: 
 1436:         {status, Action, Info} ->
 1437:             T = millis(),
 1438:             ?P("Received status message (after ~w ms) from the runner ~p: "
 1439:                "~n   ~p => ~p", [T - Timestamp, Pid, Action, Info]),
 1440:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, T);
 1441: 
 1442:         Any ->
 1443:             ?P("Received unexpected message while waiting for the runner ~p: "
 1444:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, Any]),
 1445:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp)
 1446: 
 1447:     after 5000 ->
 1448:             ?P("timeout while waiting for the runner ~p", [Pid]),
 1449:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp)
 1450:     end.
 1451: 
 1452:              
 1453: iter_max_socks_runner(_Config, _Addr, _Parent, 0, _) ->
 1454:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(0,-) -> done"),
 1455:     [];
 1456: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, initialize = First) ->
 1457:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1458:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1459:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1460:     [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, MS)];
 1461: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, failed = First) ->
 1462:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1463:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1464:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1465:     [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1466: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, First) when is_integer(First) ->
 1467:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1468:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1469:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1470:     if
 1471:         (MS =:= First) -> 
 1472: 	    [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1473:        true ->
 1474: 	    ?P("~w =/= ~w => sleeping for ~p seconds...",
 1475:                [MS, First, ?RETRY_SLEEP/1000]), 
 1476: 	    receive after ?RETRY_SLEEP -> ok end,
 1477: 	    ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> trying again", [N, First]),
 1478:             Parent ! {status, retry_socks_counting, {First, MS}},
 1479: 	    RetryMS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1480: 	    if RetryMS == First ->
 1481:                     [RetryMS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1482:                true ->
 1483:                     [RetryMS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, failed)]
 1484:             end
 1485:     end.
 1486: 
 1487: all_equal({skip, _} = SKIP) ->
 1488:     throw(SKIP);
 1489: all_equal([]) ->
 1490:     ok;
 1491: all_equal([Rule | T]) ->
 1492:     all_equal(Rule, T).
 1493: 
 1494: all_equal(Rule, [Rule | T]) ->
 1495:     all_equal(Rule, T);
 1496: all_equal(_, [_ | _]) ->
 1497:     ct:sleep(?RECOVER_SLEEP), % Wait a while and *hope* that we'll
 1498:                               % recover so other tests won't be
 1499:                               % affected.
 1500:     ct:fail(max_socket_mismatch);
 1501: all_equal(_Rule, []) ->
 1502:     ok.
 1503: 
 1504: max_socks(Config, Addr) ->
 1505:     put(state, open),
 1506:     Socks = case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 1507: 		true ->
 1508: 		    case os:type() of
 1509: 			{win32, nt} ->
 1510: 			    %% 'socket' behaves differently
 1511: 			    %% on Windows, so this test case
 1512: 			    %% needs a lot of tweaking...
 1513: 			    open_socks(Config,
 1514: 				       ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT div 2,
 1515: 				       Addr);
 1516: 			_ ->
 1517: 			    open_socks(Config, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, Addr)
 1518: 		    end;
 1519: 		_ ->
 1520: 		    open_socks(Config, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, Addr)
 1521: 
 1522: 	    end,			    
 1523:     N = length(Socks),
 1524:     put(state, close),
 1525:     lists:foreach(fun(S) -> ok = gen_tcp:close(S) end, Socks),
 1526:     put(state, ready),
 1527:     ?P("Got ~p sockets", [N]),
 1528:     N.
 1529: 
 1530: %% We loop *either* until:
 1531: %% a) We cannot create more sockets
 1532: %% b) We have reached the max number of open sockets.
 1533: %%    Going passed this limit will make the system unstable
 1534: open_socks(Config, N, Addr) ->
 1535:     case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1536: 	{ok, L} ->
 1537: 	    {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1538: 	    [L | connect_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1539: 	_ ->
 1540: 	    []
 1541:     end.
 1542: 
 1543: 
 1544: connect_accept(Config, N, L, Addr, Port) when (N > 0) ->
 1545:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1546: 	{ok, C} ->
 1547: 	    [C | do_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1548: 	_ ->
 1549: 	    []
 1550:     end;
 1551: connect_accept(_, _, _, _, _) ->
 1552:     [].
 1553: 
 1554: 
 1555: do_accept(Config, N, L, Addr, Port) ->
 1556:     case gen_tcp:accept(L) of
 1557: 	{ok, A} -> [A | connect_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1558: 	_ -> []
 1559:     end.
 1560: 
 1561: start_node(Name) ->
 1562:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1563:     ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa).
 1564: 
 1565: %% start_node(Name0, InetBackend) ->
 1566: %%     Name = list_to_atom(?F("~w_~w", [Name0, InetBackend])),
 1567: %%     start_node(Name).
 1568: 
 1569: start_remote_node(Name0, InetBackend) ->
 1570:      Name = list_to_atom(?F("~w_~w", [Name0, InetBackend])),
 1571:      Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1572:      Opts = [{remote, true}, {fail_on_error, false}],
 1573:      ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa, Opts).
 1574: 
 1575: %% Tests that when 'the other side' on a passive socket closes, the
 1576: %% connecting side can still read until the end of data.
 1577: passive_sockets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1578:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1579:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1580:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1581:                             Addr;
 1582:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1583:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1584:                     end
 1585:            end,
 1586:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_passive_sockets(Config, Addr) end,
 1587:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1588:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1589: 
 1590: 
 1591: do_passive_sockets(Config, Addr) ->
 1592:     ME = self(),
 1593:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1594:                        passive_sockets_server(Config,
 1595:                                               [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}],
 1596:                                               ME)
 1597:                end),
 1598:     receive
 1599:         {socket,Port} -> ok
 1600:     end,
 1601:     ct:sleep(500),
 1602:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1603:         {ok, Sock} ->
 1604:             passive_sockets_read(Sock);
 1605:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1606:             {skip, connect_failed_str(Reason)};
 1607:         Error ->
 1608:             ct:fail({"Could not connect to server", Error})
 1609:     end.
 1610: 
 1611: %%
 1612: %% Read until we get an {error, closed}. If we get another error, this test case
 1613: %% should fail.
 1614: %%
 1615: passive_sockets_read(Sock) ->
 1616:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0, 2000) of
 1617: 	{ok, Data} ->
 1618: 	    io:format("Received ~p bytes~n", [length(Data)]),
 1619: 	    passive_sockets_read(Sock);
 1620: 	{error, closed} ->
 1621: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock);
 1622: 	Error ->
 1623: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1624: 	    ct:fail({"Did not get {error, closed} before other error", Error})
 1625:     end.
 1626: 
 1627: passive_sockets_server(Config, Opts, Parent) ->
 1628:     case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, Opts) of
 1629:         {ok, LSock} ->
 1630:             {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(LSock),
 1631:             Parent ! {socket,Port},
 1632:             passive_sockets_server_accept(LSock);
 1633:         Error ->
 1634:             ct:fail({"Could not create listen socket", Error})
 1635:     end.
 1636: 
 1637: passive_sockets_server_accept(Sock) ->
 1638:     case gen_tcp:accept(Sock) of
 1639:         {ok, Socket} ->
 1640:             timer:sleep(500),			% Simulate latency
 1641:             passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, 5),
 1642:             passive_sockets_server_accept(Sock);
 1643:         Error ->
 1644:             ct:fail({"Could not accept connection", Error})
 1645:     end.
 1646: 
 1647: passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, 0) ->
 1648:     io:format("Closing other end..~n", []),
 1649:     gen_tcp:close(Socket);
 1650: passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, X) ->
 1651:     Data = lists:duplicate(1024*X, $a),
 1652:     case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Data) of
 1653:         ok ->
 1654:             ct:sleep(50),   % Simulate some processing.
 1655:             passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, X-1);
 1656:         {error, _Reason} ->
 1657:             ct:fail("Failed to send data")
 1658:     end.
 1659: 
 1660: 
 1661: %% Tests the return value from gen_tcp:accept when
 1662: %% the socket is closed from another process. (OTP-3817)
 1663: accept_closed_by_other_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1664:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1665:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1666:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1667:                             Addr;
 1668:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1669:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1670:                     end
 1671:            end,
 1672:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_accept_closed_by_other_process(Config, Addr) end,
 1673:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1674:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1675: 
 1676: do_accept_closed_by_other_process(Config, Addr) ->
 1677:     Parent = self(),
 1678:     {ok, ListenSocket} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1679:     Child =
 1680: 	spawn_link(
 1681: 	  fun() ->
 1682: 		  Parent ! {self(), gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket)}
 1683: 	  end),
 1684:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1685:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket),
 1686:     receive
 1687:         {Child, {error, closed}} ->
 1688:             ok;
 1689:         {Child, Other} ->
 1690:             ct:fail({"Wrong result of gen_tcp:accept", Other})
 1691:     end.
 1692: 
 1693: repeat(N, Fun) ->
 1694:     repeat(N, N, Fun).
 1695: 
 1696: repeat(N, T, Fun) when is_integer(N), N > 0 ->
 1697:     Fun(T-N),
 1698:     repeat(N-1, T, Fun);
 1699: repeat(_, _, _) ->
 1700:     ok.
 1701: 
 1702: 
 1703: %% Tests the response when using a closed socket as argument.
 1704: closed_socket(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1705:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1706:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1707:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1708:                             Addr;
 1709:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1710:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1711:                     end
 1712:            end,
 1713:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_closed_socket(Config, Addr) end,
 1714:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1715:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1716: 
 1717: do_closed_socket(Config, Addr) ->
 1718:     {ok, LS1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1719:     erlang:yield(),
 1720:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS1),
 1721:     %% If the following delay is uncommented, the result error values
 1722:     %% below will change from {error, einval} to {error, closed} since
 1723:     %% inet_db then will have noticed that the socket is closed.
 1724:     %% This is a scheduling issue, i.e when the gen_server in 
 1725:     %% in inet_db processes the 'EXIT' message from the port,
 1726:     %% the socket is unregistered.
 1727:     %%
 1728:     %% ct:sleep({seconds,2})
 1729:     %%
 1730:     {error, R_send}   = gen_tcp:send(LS1, "data"),
 1731:     {error, R_recv}   = gen_tcp:recv(LS1, 17),
 1732:     {error, R_accept} = gen_tcp:accept(LS1),
 1733:     {error, R_controlling_process} =
 1734: 	gen_tcp:controlling_process(LS1, self()),
 1735:     %%
 1736:     ok = ?P("R_send = ~p", [R_send]),
 1737:     ok = ?P("R_recv = ~p", [R_recv]),
 1738:     ok = ?P("R_accept = ~p", [R_accept]),
 1739:     ok = ?P("R_controlling_process = ~p", [R_controlling_process]),
 1740:     ok.
 1741: 
 1742: %%%
 1743: %%% Test using the gen_tcp:shutdown/2 function using a sort server.
 1744: %%% 
 1745: 
 1746: shutdown_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1747:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1748:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1749:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1750:                             Addr;
 1751:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1752:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1753:                     end
 1754:            end,
 1755:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> shutdown_common(Config, Addr, true) end,
 1756:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1757:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1758: 
 1759: shutdown_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1760:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1761:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1762:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1763:                             Addr;
 1764:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1765:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1766:                     end
 1767:            end,
 1768:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> shutdown_common(Config, Addr, false) end,
 1769:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1770:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1771: 
 1772: shutdown_common(Config, Addr, Active) ->
 1773:     ?P("start sort server"),
 1774:     P = sort_server(Config, Addr, Active),
 1775:     ?P("Sort server port: ~p", [P]),
 1776: 
 1777: 
 1778:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1779:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["glurf"]),
 1780:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["abc","nisse","dum"]),
 1781: 
 1782:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 255)]),
 1783:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(77, 999)]),
 1784:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 55)]),
 1785:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1786:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["apa"]),
 1787:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["kluns","gorilla"]),
 1788:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 1233)]),
 1789:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1790:     receive
 1791: 	Any ->
 1792: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message,Any})
 1793:     after 0 -> ok
 1794:     end.
 1795: 
 1796: do_sort(Config, Addr, P, List0) ->
 1797:     ?P("Sort: "
 1798:        "~n   ~p", [List0]),
 1799:     List = [El++"\n" || El <- List0],
 1800:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, P, [{ip, Addr}, {packet,line}]) of
 1801:             {ok, Socket} ->
 1802:                 Socket;
 1803:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1804:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1805:         end,
 1806:     %% ok = inet:setopts(S, [{debug, true}]),
 1807:     ?P("Send Lines: "
 1808:        "~n   ~p", [List]),
 1809:     send_lines(S, List),
 1810:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1811:     Lines = collect_lines(S, true),
 1812:     ?P("Collected: "
 1813:        "~n   ~p", [Lines]),
 1814:     SortedLines = lists:sort(List),
 1815:     ?P("Sorted: "
 1816:        "~n   ~p", [SortedLines]),
 1817:     case SortedLines of
 1818:         Lines ->
 1819:             ok;
 1820:         _ ->
 1821:             LmSL = Lines -- SortedLines,
 1822:             SLmL = SortedLines -- Lines,
 1823:             ?P("Not identical after sorting:"
 1824:                "~n   Lines -- SortedLines: "
 1825:                "~n      ~p"
 1826:                "~n   SortedLines -- Lines: "
 1827:                "~n      ~p", [LmSL, SLmL]),
 1828:             Lines = SortedLines
 1829:     end,
 1830:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S).
 1831: 
 1832: sort_server(Config, Addr, Active) ->
 1833:     Opts = [{ip, Addr}, {exit_on_close,false},{packet,line},{active,Active}],
 1834:     {ok,L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, Opts),
 1835:     Go = make_ref(),
 1836:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1837:                              receive Go -> sort_server_1(L, Active) end
 1838:                      end),
 1839:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(L, Pid),
 1840:     Pid ! Go,
 1841:     {ok,Port} = inet:port(L),
 1842:     Port.
 1843: 
 1844: %% Acceptor loop
 1845: sort_server_1(L, Active) ->
 1846:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1847:     Go = make_ref(),
 1848:     Sorter = spawn(fun() -> receive Go -> sorter(S, Active) end end),
 1849:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(S, Sorter),
 1850:     Sorter ! Go,
 1851:     sort_server_1(L, Active).
 1852: 
 1853: %% Sorter
 1854: sorter(S, Active) ->
 1855:     ?P("[sorter] try receive lines for sorting"),
 1856:     Lines = collect_lines(S, Active),
 1857:     SortedLines = lists:sort(Lines),
 1858:     ?P("[sorter]"
 1859:        "~n   received Lines: "
 1860:        "~n      ~p"
 1861:        "~n   (send) sorted Lines: "
 1862:        "~n      ~p", [Lines, SortedLines]),
 1863:     send_lines(S, SortedLines),
 1864:     gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1865:     gen_tcp:close(S).
 1866: 
 1867: collect_lines(S, true) ->
 1868:     collect_lines_1(S, []);
 1869: collect_lines(S, false) ->
 1870:     passive_collect_lines_1(S, []).
 1871: 
 1872: collect_lines_1(S, Acc) ->
 1873:     receive
 1874: 	{tcp,S,Line} ->
 1875:             ?P("collect_lines_1(~w): ~p", [S, Line]),
 1876:             collect_lines_1(S, [Line|Acc]);
 1877: 	{tcp_closed,S} ->
 1878:             ?P("collect_lines_1(~w): tcp_closed", [S]),
 1879:             lists:reverse(Acc)
 1880:     end.
 1881: 
 1882: passive_collect_lines_1(S, Acc) ->
 1883:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 1884: 	{ok,Line} -> passive_collect_lines_1(S, [Line|Acc]);
 1885: 	{error,closed} -> lists:reverse(Acc)
 1886:     end.
 1887: 
 1888: 
 1889: send_lines(S, Lines) ->    
 1890:     lists:foreach(fun(Line) ->
 1891:                           ?P("send_line(~w): ~p", [S, Line]),
 1892: 			  ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Line)
 1893: 		  end, Lines).
 1894: 
 1895: %%%
 1896: %%% Shutdown pending.
 1897: %%%
 1898: 
 1899: shutdown_pending(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1900:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1901:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1902:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1903:                             Addr;
 1904:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1905:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1906:                     end
 1907:            end,
 1908:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_shutdown_pending(Config, Addr) end,
 1909:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1910:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1911: 
 1912: do_shutdown_pending(Config, Addr) ->
 1913:     N = 512*1024+17,
 1914:     ?P("N: ~p", [N]),
 1915:     Data = [<<N:32>>,ones(N),42],
 1916:     {Port, Pid} = a_server(Config, Addr),
 1917:     ?P("try connect to server (port: ~p)", [Port]),
 1918:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1919:             {ok, Socket} ->
 1920:                 ?P("connected"),
 1921:                 Socket;
 1922:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1923:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1924:         end,
 1925:     ?P("send"),
 1926:     gen_tcp:send(S, Data),
 1927:     ?P("shutdown(write)"),
 1928:     gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1929:     ?P("await data message"),
 1930:     case sp_await_data(Pid, S) of
 1931:         N ->
 1932:             ok;
 1933:         InvalidN ->
 1934:             ?P("Invalid message: "
 1935:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1936:                "~n   Received: ~p", [N, InvalidN]),
 1937:             ct:fail({unexpected_msg, N, InvalidN})
 1938:     end,
 1939:     ?P("done"),
 1940:     ok.
 1941: 
 1942: sp_await_data(Pid, Sock) ->
 1943:     receive
 1944:         {tcp, Sock, Msg} ->
 1945:             ?P("got tcp (data) message: ~p", [Msg]),
 1946:             list_to_integer(Msg) - 5;
 1947:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
 1948:             ?P("server exited normal"),
 1949:             sp_await_data(Pid, Sock);
 1950:         Other ->
 1951:             ?P("UNEXPECTED: "
 1952:                "~n   ~p", [Other]),
 1953:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1954:     end.
 1955: 
 1956:  ones(0) -> [];
 1957:  ones(1) -> [1];
 1958:  ones(N) ->
 1959:      Half = N div 2,
 1960:      Ones = ones(Half),
 1961:      case 2*Half of
 1962: 	 N -> [Ones|Ones];
 1963: 	 _ -> [1,Ones|Ones]
 1964:      end.
 1965: 
 1966: a_server(Config, Addr) ->
 1967:      {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {exit_on_close,false},{active,false}]),
 1968:      Pid        = spawn_link(fun() -> a_server2(L) end),
 1969:      ok         = gen_tcp:controlling_process(L, Pid),
 1970:      {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 1971:      {Port, Pid}.
 1972: 
 1973: a_server2(L) ->
 1974:      {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1975:      do_recv(S, []).
 1976: 
 1977:  do_recv(S, Bs0) ->
 1978:      case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 1979: 	 {ok,B} ->
 1980: 	     do_recv(S, [Bs0,B]);
 1981: 	 {error,closed} ->
 1982: 	     Bs = list_to_binary(Bs0),
 1983: 	     gen_tcp:send(S, integer_to_list(byte_size(Bs))),
 1984: 	     gen_tcp:close(S)
 1985:      end.
 1986: 
 1987: %%
 1988: %% Test 'show_econnreset' option
 1989: %%
 1990: 
 1991: show_econnreset_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1992:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1993:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1994:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1995:                             Addr;
 1996:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1997:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1998:                     end
 1999:            end,
 2000:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_active(Config, Addr) end,
 2001:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2002:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2003: 
 2004: do_show_econnreset_active(Config, Addr) ->
 2005:     %% First confirm everything works with option turned off.
 2006:     ?P("test with option switched off (default)"),
 2007:     {ok, L0} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 2008:     {ok, Port0} = inet:port(L0),
 2009:     Client0 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port0,
 2010:                             [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2011:                  {ok, CSock0} ->
 2012:                      CSock0;
 2013:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason0} ->
 2014:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason0))
 2015:               end,
 2016:     {ok, S0} = gen_tcp:accept(L0),
 2017:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L0),
 2018:     ok = inet:setopts(Client0, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2019:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client0),
 2020:     receive
 2021:        {tcp_closed, S0} ->
 2022: 	   ok;
 2023:        Other0 ->
 2024: 	   ct:fail({unexpected, off, closed, Other0})
 2025:     after 1000 ->
 2026: 	ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2027:     end,
 2028: 
 2029:     %% Now test with option switched on.
 2030:     %% Note: We are also testing that the show_econnreset option is
 2031:     %% inherited from the listening socket by the accepting socket.
 2032:     ?P("test with option explicitly switched on"),
 2033:     {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{show_econnreset, true}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2034:     {ok, Port1} = inet:port(L1),
 2035:     Client1 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port1,
 2036:                             [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2037:                   {ok, CSock1} ->
 2038:                       CSock1;
 2039:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2040:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2041:               end,
 2042:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:accept(L1),
 2043:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),
 2044:     ok = inet:setopts(Client1, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2045:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client1),
 2046:     receive
 2047: 	{tcp_error, S1, econnreset} ->
 2048: 	    receive
 2049: 		{tcp_closed, S1} ->
 2050:                     ?P("done"),
 2051: 		    ok;
 2052: 		Other1 ->
 2053:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED (expected closed):"
 2054:                        "~n   ~p", [Other1]),
 2055: 		    ct:fail({unexpected, on, closed, Other1})
 2056: 	    after 1 ->
 2057:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED timeout (expected closed)"),
 2058:                     ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2059: 	    end;
 2060: 	Other2 ->
 2061:             ?P("UNEXPECTED (expected error:econnreset):"
 2062:                "~n   ~p", [Other2]),
 2063: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, on, econnreset, Other2})
 2064:     after 1000 ->
 2065:             ?P("UNEXPECTED timeout (expected error:econnreset)"),
 2066:             ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_error}})
 2067:     end.
 2068: 
 2069: show_econnreset_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2070:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2071:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2072:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2073:                             Addr;
 2074:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2075:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2076:                     end
 2077:            end,
 2078:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_active_once(Config, Addr) end,
 2079:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2080:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2081: 
 2082: do_show_econnreset_active_once(Config, Addr) ->
 2083:     %% Now test using {active, once}

 2085:                       [{active, false},

 2112: 	    end;

 2114: 	    ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})

 2116: 	ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_error}})
 2117:     end.

 2119: show_econnreset_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

 2125:                             throw({skip, Reason})

 2135:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 2136:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of

 2138:                      CSock;

 2144:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),

 2146:     ok = ct:sleep(1),
 2147:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Client, 0),
 2148:

 2154:                       [{active,          false},

 2158:                 CSock1;

 2160:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2161:         end,

 2163:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),

 2233: ecr_ass_send(Config, Sock, Expected) ->
 2234:     case os:type() of
 2235: 	{win32, nt} ->
 2236: 	    case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 2237: 		true ->
 2238: 		    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, 2);
 2239: 		false ->
 2240: 		    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, 1)
 2241: 	    end;
 2242: 	_ ->
 2243: 	    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, 1)
 2244:     end.
 2245: 
 2246: do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, N) when (N > 0) ->
 2247:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, "Whatever") of
 2248: 	{error, Expected} ->
 2249: 	    ?P("[~w] expected send result", [N]),
 2250: 	    ok;
 2251: 	{error, Unexpected} ->
 2252: 	    ?P("[~w] unexpected send error: "
 2253: 	       "~n   Expected:   ~p"
 2254: 	       "~n   Unexpected: ~p", [N, Expected, Unexpected]),
 2255: 	    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, N-1);
 2256: 	ok ->
 2257: 	    ?P("[~w] unexpected send success", [N]),
 2258: 	    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, N-1)
 2259:     end;
 2260: do_ecr_ass_send(_Sock, _Expected, _) ->
 2261:     error.

 2264: econnreset_after_async_send_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2265:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2266:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2267:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2268:                             Addr;
 2269:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2270:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2271:                     end
 2272:            end,
 2273:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_econnreset_after_async_send_active(Config, Addr) end,
 2274:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2275:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
