 8061: otp_13939(doc) ->
 8062:     ["Check that writing to a remotely closed socket doesn't block forever "
 8063:      "when exit_on_close is false."];
 8064: otp_13939(suite) ->
 8065:     [];
 8066: otp_13939(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8067:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_opt(
 8068:         fun() ->
 8069:             {ok, Listener} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{exit_on_close, false}]),
 8070:             {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listener),
 8071: 
 8072:             spawn_link(
 8073:                 fun() ->
 8074:                     {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, "localhost", Port,
 8075:                         [{active, false}]),
 8076:                     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client)
 8077:                 end),
 8078: 
 8079:             {ok, Accepted} = gen_tcp:accept(Listener),
 8080: 
 8081:             ok = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8082: 
 8083:             %% The bug surfaces when there's a delay between the send
 8084:             %% operations; inet:getstat is a red herring.
 8085:             timer:sleep(100),
 8086: 
 8087:             {error, Code} = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8088:             ct:pal("gen_tcp:send returned ~p~n", [Code])
 8089:         end, [link, monitor]),
 8090: 
 8091:     receive
 8092:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} ->
 8093:             ok
 8094:     after 1000 ->
 8095:         demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
 8096:         exit(Pid, normal),
 8097:         ct:fail("Server process blocked on send.")
 8098:     end.
 8099: 
 8100: 
 8101: %% No point in running this as the test case with inet_backend = socket
 8102: %% as it tests a bug in the inet driver that cannot reproduced with
 8103: %% inet_backend = socket.
 8104: otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8105:     Cond = fun() ->
 8106: 		   case os:type() of
 8107: 		       {win32,_} ->
 8108: 			   %% Even if we set sndbuf and recbuf to small sizes
 8109: 			   %% Windows either happily accepts to send GBytes of
 8110: 			   %% data in no time, so the second send below that
 8111: 			   %% is supposed to time out just succeeds, or the 
 8112: 			   %% first send that is supposed to fill the inet_drv
 8113: 			   %% I/O queue and start waiting for when more data
 8114: 			   %% can be sent instead sends all data but suffers
 8115: 			   %% a send failure that closes the socket.
 8116: 			   {skip, backpressure_broken_on_win32};
 8117: 		       _ ->
 8118: 			   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8119: 			       true ->
 8120: 				   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
 8121: 			       false ->
 8122: 				   ok
 8123: 			   end
 8124: 		   end
 8125: 	   end,
 8126:     TC = fun() -> do_otp_12242(Config) end,
 8127:     ?TC_TRY(otp_12242, Cond, TC).
 8128: 
 8129: do_otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8130:     %% Find the IPv4 address of an up and running interface
 8131:     %% that is not loopback nor pointtopoint
 8132:     {ok, IFList} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 8133:     ?P("IFList "
 8134:        "~n      ~p", [IFList]),
 8135:     case
 8136: 	lists:flatten(
 8137: 	  [lists:filtermap(
 8138: 	     fun ({addr, Addr}) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8139: 		     {true, Addr};
 8140: 		 (_) ->
 8141: 		     false
 8142: 	     end, Opts)
 8143: 	   || {_,Opts} <- IFList,
 8144: 	      case lists:keyfind(flags, 1, Opts) of
 8145: 		  {_,Flags} ->
 8146: 		      lists:member(up, Flags)
 8147: 			  andalso
 8148: 			  lists:member(running, Flags)
 8149: 			  andalso
 8150: 			  not lists:member(loopback, Flags)
 8151: 			  andalso
 8152: 			  not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags);
 8153: 		  false ->
 8154: 		      false
 8155: 	      end])
 8156:     of
 8157: 	[Addr|_] ->
 8158: 	    otp_12242(Config, Addr);
 8159: 	Other ->
 8160: 	    ?SKIPT({no_external_address, Other})
 8161:     end.
 8162: 
 8163: %%
 8164: otp_12242(Config, Addr) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8165:     ct:timetrap(30000),
 8166:     ?P("Using address ~p", [Addr]),
 8167:     Bufsize  = 16 * 1024,
 8168:     Datasize = 128 * 1024 * 1024, % At least 1 s on GBit interface
 8169:     Blob     = binary:copy(<<$x>>, Datasize),
 8170:     LOpts =
 8171:         [{backlog,   4},
 8172: 	 {reuseaddr, true},
 8173: 	 {ip,        Addr},
 8174:          binary,
 8175: 	 {active,    false},
 8176:          {recbuf,    Bufsize},
 8177: 	 {sndbuf,    Bufsize},
 8178: 	 {buffer,    Bufsize}],
 8179:     COpts =
 8180:         [binary,
 8181: 	 {active,       false},
 8182: 	 {ip,           Addr},
 8183:          {linger,       {true, 1}}, % 1 s
 8184:          {send_timeout, 500},
 8185:          {recbuf,       Bufsize},
 8186: 	 {sndbuf,       Bufsize},
 8187: 	 {buffer,       Bufsize}],
 8188:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 8189:     {ok, ListenerNode} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir),
 8190:     Tester = self(),
 8191:     ?P("create listener"),
 8192:     {Listener, ListenerMRef} =
 8193:         spawn_opt(
 8194:           ListenerNode,
 8195:           fun () ->
 8196: 		  ?P("create listen socket"),
 8197:                   {ok,L}     = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, LOpts),
 8198:                   {ok,LPort} = inet:port(L),
 8199: 		  ?P("inform tester about port number: ~w", [LPort]),
 8200:                   Tester ! {self(), port, LPort},
 8201: 		  ?P("try accept"),
 8202:                   {ok, A}    = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8203: 		  ?P("accepted - close listen socket"),
 8204:                   ok         = gen_tcp:close(L),
 8205: 		  ?P("await close order"),
 8206:                   receive
 8207:                       {Tester, stop} ->
 8208: 			  ?P("close order received - close accepted socket"),
 8209:                           ok = gen_tcp:close(A)
 8210:                   end
 8211:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8212:     ?P("await listen port"),
 8213:     LPort = receive {Listener,port,P} -> P end,
 8214:     ?P("try connect to ~w", [LPort]),
 8215:     {ok,C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, LPort, COpts, infinity),
 8216:     ?P("connected - get buffers"),
 8217:     {ok, ReadCOpts} = inet:getopts(C, [recbuf,sndbuf,buffer]),
 8218:     ?P("connected sockets buffers:"
 8219:        "~n      ~p", [ReadCOpts]),
 8220: 
 8221:     otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize),
 8222: 
 8223:     ?P("send listener stop"),
 8224:     Listener ! {Tester, stop},
 8225:     ?P("await listener termination"),
 8226:     wait(ListenerMRef),
 8227:     ?P("stop listener node"),
 8228:     ?STOP_NODE(ListenerNode),
 8229:     ?P("done"),
 8230:     ok.
 8231:     
 8232: 
 8233: otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8234:     %% Fill the buffers
 8235:     ?P("sending ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8236:     case gen_tcp:send(C, Blob) of
 8237:         ok ->
 8238:             ?P("sent ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8239:             otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize);
 8240:         {error, {timeout, _RestData}} ->
 8241:             %% We filled the buffers and timed out;
 8242:             %% this is probably the socket backend - give up.
 8243:             ok;
 8244:         {error, timeout} ->
 8245:             %% The same as the previous clause
 8246:             ok
 8247:     end,
 8248:     _ = gen_tcp:close(C),
 8249:     ok.
 8250: 
 8251: otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8252:     %% Try to ensure that the close call is in progress
 8253:     %% before the owner proceeds with sending
 8254:     CloserMRef = otp_12242_closer(C),
 8255:     
 8256:     ?P("await tref"),
 8257:     receive
 8258:         {tref,Tref} ->
 8259: 	    ?P("tref received - now await trigger timeout"),
 8260:             receive {timeout,Tref,_} -> ok end,
 8261:             ?P("trigger timeout received - try send ~p bytes again",
 8262: 	       [Datasize]),
 8263:             %% Now should the close be in progress...
 8264:             %% All buffers are full, remote end is not reading,
 8265:             %% and the send timeout is 1 s so this will timeout:
 8266:             {error, timeout} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8267:             ?P("expected timeout - update send_timeout (to 10000)"),
 8268:             ok = inet:setopts(C, [{send_timeout, 10000}]),
 8269:             %% There is a hidden timeout here.  Port close is sampled
 8270:             %% every 5 s by prim_inet:send_recv_reply.
 8271:             %% Linger is 3 s so the Closer will finish this send:
 8272:             ?P("try send ~p bytes - expect error (closed)", [Datasize]),
 8273:             {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8274:             ?P("await closer termination"),
 8275:             normal = wait(CloserMRef),
 8276:             ok
 8277:     end.
 8278: 
 8279: otp_12242_closer(C) ->
 8280:     Owner = self(),
 8281:     {_Closer, CloserMref} =
 8282:         spawn_opt(
 8283:           fun () ->
 8284:                   ?P("[closer] starting"),
 8285:                   Owner ! {tref, erlang:start_timer(50, Owner, closing)},
 8286:                   ?P("[closer] calling gen_tcp:close(C)"),
 8287:                   try gen_tcp:close(C) of
 8288:                       Result ->
 8289:                           ?P("[closer] gen_tcp:close(C) -> ~p", [Result]),
 8290:                           ok = Result
 8291:                   catch
 8292:                       Class:Reason:Stacktrace ->
 8293:                           ?P("[closer] caught gen_tcp:close(C):"
 8294: 			     "~n      Error Class:  ~p"
 8295: 			     "~n      Error:        ~p"
 8296: 			     "~n      Stack trace:  ~p",
 8297:                             [Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
 8298:                           erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
 8299:                   end
 8300:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8301:     CloserMref.
 8302: 
 8303: 
 8304: wait(Mref) ->
 8305:     receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} -> Reason end.
 8306: 
 8307: %% OTP-15536
 8308: %% Test that send error works correctly for delay_send
 8309: delay_send_error(Config) ->
 8310:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 8311:     {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 8312:     {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip,        Addr},
 8313:                                      {reuseaddr, true},
 8314:                                      {packet,    1},
 8315:                                      {active,    false}]),
 8316:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(L),
 8317: 
 8318:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, false),
 8319:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, true),
 8320:     ?P("close listen socket"),
 8321:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 8322: 
 8323: delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, Active) ->
 8324:     ?P("try connect - with delay_send:true active:~p",[Active]),
 8325:     {ok, C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 8326:                        [{ip,         Addr},
 8327:                         {packet,     1},
 8328:                         {active,     Active},
 8329:                         {delay_send, true}]),
 8330:     ?P("try accept"),
 8331:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8332:     %% Do a couple of sends first to see that it works
 8333:     ?P("send data"),
 8334:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8335:     ?P("send data"),
 8336:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8337:     ?P("send data"),
 8338:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8339:     %% Close the receiver
 8340:     ?P("close receiver (accepted socket)"),
 8341:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(C, write),
 8342:     %%
 8343:     ?P("send data"),
 8344:     case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8345:         ok ->
 8346:             ?P("send data"),
 8347:             case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8348:                 ok ->
 8349:                     delay_send_error2(C);
 8350:                 {error, closed} ->
 8351:                     ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8352:                     ok
 8353:             end;
 8354: 
 8355:         {error, closed} ->
 8356:             ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8357:             ok;
 8358: 
 8359:         {error, #{info := eshutdown = R}} ->
 8360:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8361:             ok;
 8362:         {error, eshutdown = R} ->
 8363:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8364:             ok
 8365:     end,
 8366:     ?P("close accepted socket"),
 8367:     ok = gen_tcp:close(A),
 8368:     ?P("close connected socket"),
 8369:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C).
 8370: 
 8371: 
 8372: delay_send_error2(Sock) ->
 8373:     delay_send_error2(Sock, 3).
 8374: 
 8375: delay_send_error2(Sock, 0) ->
 8376:     gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 8377:     ct:fail("Unexpected send success");
 8378: delay_send_error2(Sock, N) ->
 8379:     %% Sleep in order for delay_send to have time to trigger
 8380:     %% This used to result in a double free
 8381:     timer:sleep(1000),
 8382:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, "hello") of
 8383:         ok ->
 8384:             delay_send_error2(Sock, N-1);
 8385:         {error, closed} ->
 8386:             ?P("closed (expected, ~w)", [N]),
 8387:             ok;
 8388:         {error, Reason} ->
 8389:             ct:fail(?F("Unexpected send error: ~p", [Reason]))
 8390:     end.
 8391: 
 8392:     
 8393: 
 8394: 
 8395: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8396: 
 8397: 
 8398: -define(MAX_WORKERS, 30).
 8399: 
 8400: %% 30-second test for gen_tcp in {active, N} mode,
 8401: %% ensuring it does not get stuck.
 8402: %% Verifies that erl_check_io properly handles extra EPOLLIN signals.
 8403: %% We do not bother with this test case on inet_backend = socket
 8404: %% since the test is about the inet-driver!
 8405: bidirectional_traffic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8406:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 8407:     Cond = fun() ->
 8408: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8409: 		       true ->
 8410: 			   {skip, "Inet driver specific test"};
 8411: 		       false ->
 8412: 			   ok
 8413: 		   end
 8414: 	   end,
 8415:     Pre  = fun() ->
 8416: 		   Addr =
 8417: 		       case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8418: 			   {ok, A} ->
 8419: 			       A;
 8420: 			   {error, Reason} ->
 8421: 			       ?SKIPT({skip, Reason})
 8422: 		       end,
 8423:                    NumOnlineScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 8424:                    NumWorkers0     = NumOnlineScheds * 2,
 8425:                    {NumWorkers, ActiveN} =
 8426:                        if
 8427:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 10) ->
 8428:                                {NumWorkers0, 20};
 8429:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 20) ->
 8430:                                {NumWorkers0, 18};
 8431:                            (NumWorkers0 =< ?MAX_WORKERS) ->
 8432:                                {NumWorkers0, 15};
 8433:                            true ->
 8434:                                {?MAX_WORKERS, 15}
 8435:                        end,
 8436:                    ?P("pre ->"
 8437:                       "~n   Number Of Online Schedulers: ~w"
 8438:                       "~n   =>"
 8439:                       "~n      Use workers: ~w"
 8440:                       "~n      ActiveN:     ~w",
 8441:                       [NumOnlineScheds, NumWorkers, ActiveN]),
 8442:                    Payload = bdt_payload(32),
 8443:                    {ok, LSock} = ?LISTEN(Config,
 8444:                                          0,
 8445:                                          [binary,
 8446:                                           {ip,        Addr},
 8447: 					  {packet,    0},
 8448:                                           {active,    false},
 8449:                                           {reuseaddr, true}]),
 8450:                    %% get all sockets to know failing ends
 8451:                    ?P("pre -> listen socket created: "
 8452:                       "~n      ~p", [LSock]),
 8453:                    #{lsock       => LSock,
 8454: 		     addr        => Addr,
 8455:                      num_workers => NumWorkers,
 8456:                      payload     => Payload,
 8457:                      %% The point of this is to make it "easy" to 
 8458:                      %% "configure" this value...
 8459:                      active_n    => ActiveN}
 8460:            end,
 8461:     Case = fun(Info) -> do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, Info) end,
 8462:     Post = fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8463:                    ?P("post -> close listen socket"),
 8464:                    (catch gen_tcp:close(LSock))
 8465:            end,
 8466:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8467:             Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 8468: 
 8469: bdt_payload(N) ->
 8470:     rand:bytes(N).
 8471:     
 8472: 
 8473: do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, #{lsock       := LSock,
 8474:                                    num_workers := NumWorkers} = Info) ->
 8475:     ?P("case -> begin"),
 8476:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(LSock),
 8477:     ?P("case -> listen socket port number ~w", [Port]),
 8478:     Control = self(),
 8479:     ?P("case -> create ~w receivers", [NumWorkers]),
 8480:     Receivers = [spawn_link(fun () -> 
 8481: 				    exchange(Config,
 8482:                                              Info#{port => Port,
 8483:                                                    ctrl => Control})
 8484: 			    end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, NumWorkers)],
 8485:     ?P("case -> await the result"),
 8486:     %% Should we not collect as many as possible?
 8487:     %% To see how many as issues?
 8488:     Result =
 8489: 	%% If any of the receivers report, we have an error
 8490:         receive
 8491:             {timeout, Socket, Total} ->
 8492:                 ?P("case -> timeout msg for ~p: received ~w", [Socket, Total]),
 8493:                 throw({fail, {timeout, Socket, Total}});
 8494: 	    {error, Socket, Reason} ->
 8495:                 ?P("case -> error msg for ~p: ~p", [Socket, Reason]),
 8496:                 throw({fail, {error, Socket, Reason}})
 8497:         after 30000 ->
 8498:                 %% if it does not fail in 30 seconds, it most likely works
 8499:                 ?P("case -> timeout => success"),
 8500:                 ok
 8501:         end,
 8502:     ?P("case -> ensure all receivers terminated"),
 8503:     %% [begin unlink(Rec), exit(Rec, kill) end || Rec <- Receivers],
 8504:     bt_terminate_receivers(Receivers),
 8505:     ?P("case -> done"),
 8506:     Result.
 8507: 
 8508: %% The point of this (function) is so that the 'receivers' should
 8509: %% get a chance to "tell us" what they are up to...
 8510: bt_terminate_receivers(Recvs) ->
 8511:     bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs),
 8512:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8513:     bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs).
 8514: 
 8515: bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs) ->
 8516:     [begin
 8517:          unlink(Recv),
 8518:          Recv ! terminate
 8519:      end || Recv <- Recvs].
 8520: 
 8521: bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs) ->
 8522:     [exit(Recv, kill) || Recv <- Recvs].
 8523:     
 8524: exchange(Config, #{lsock    := LSock,
 8525: 		   addr     := Addr,
 8526:                    port     := Port, 
 8527:                    payload  := Payload,
 8528:                    ctrl     := Control,
 8529:                    active_n := ActiveN}) ->
 8530:     %% spin up client
 8531:     _ClntRcv = spawn_link(
 8532:         fun () ->
 8533:                 ?P("exchange:client -> connect"),
 8534:                 {ok, Client} =
 8535:                     ?CONNECT(Config,
 8536: 			     Addr,
 8537: 			     Port,
 8538: 			     [binary,
 8539: 			      {ip, Addr}, {packet, 0}, {active, ActiveN}]),
 8540:                 ?P("exchange:client -> connected: ~p"
 8541:                    "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8542:                    "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8543:                    [Client,
 8544:                     oki(inet:peername(Client)), oki(inet:sockname(Client))]),
 8545:                 put(role, connected),
 8546:                 send_recv_loop(Client, Payload, Control, ActiveN)
 8547:         end),
 8548:     ?P("exchange -> accept"),
 8549:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 8550:     ?P("exchange -> accepted: ~p"
 8551:        "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8552:        "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8553:        [Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket))]),
 8554:     %% sending process
 8555:     put(role, accepted),
 8556:     send_recv_loop(Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN).
 8557: 
 8558: send_recv_loop(Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8559:     %% {active, N} must be set to active > 12 to trigger the issue
 8560:     %% {active, 30} seems to trigger it quite often & reliably
 8561:     Role = get(role),
 8562:     ?P("[~w] set (initial) active: ~p", [Role, ActiveN]),
 8563:     inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8564:     ?P("[~w] spawn sender", [Role]),
 8565:     _Snd = spawn_link(
 8566:         fun Sender() ->
 8567:             case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Payload) of
 8568:                 ok ->
 8569:                     Sender();
 8570:                 {error, closed} ->
 8571:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Socket closed", [Role]),
 8572:                     exit(normal);
 8573:                 {error, Reason} ->
 8574:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Send failed: "
 8575:                        "~n      ~p", [Role, Reason]),
 8576:                     exit({send_failed, Reason})
 8577:             end
 8578:         end),
 8579:     ?P("[~w] begin recv", [Role]),
 8580:     recv(Socket, 0, 0, 0, Control, ActiveN).
 8581: 
 8582: recv(Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8583:     receive
 8584:         terminate ->
 8585:             ?P("[~w,recv] received terminate message when"
 8586:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8587:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8588:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8589:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8590:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8591:                [get(role),
 8592:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8593:                 Socket, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8594:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8595:             exit(normal);
 8596: 
 8597:         {tcp, Socket, Data} ->
 8598:             recv(Socket,
 8599:                  Total + byte_size(Data), TotIter + 1, TotAct,
 8600:                  Control, ActiveN);
 8601:         {tcp_passive, Socket} ->
 8602:             inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8603:             recv(Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct + 1, Control, ActiveN);
 8604:         {tcp_closed, Socket} ->
 8605:             ?P("[~w,recv] closed when"
 8606:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8607:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8608:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8609:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8610: 	       [get(role), Total, TotIter, TotAct, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8611: 	    ok;
 8612: 
 8613:         Other ->
 8614:             ?P("[~w,recv] received unexpected message"
 8615:                "~n      Msg:               ~p"
 8616:                "~n   when:"
 8617:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8618:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8619:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8620:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8621:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8622:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8623:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8624:                [get(role),
 8625:                 Other,
 8626:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8627:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8628:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8629:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8630:             Control ! {error, Socket, Other}
 8631: 
 8632:     after 2000 ->
 8633:             %% no data received in 2 seconds => test failed
 8634:             ?P("[~w,recv timeout] received nothing when:"
 8635:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8636:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8637:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8638:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8639:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8640:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8641:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8642:                [get(role),
 8643:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8644:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8645:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8646:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8647:             Control ! {timeout, Socket, Total}
 8648:     end.
 8649: 
 8650: 
 8651: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8652: 
 8653: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8654: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8655: %% monitors to it...
 8656: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8657:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8658:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8659:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8660:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8661:                             Addr;
 8662:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8663:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8664:                     end
 8665:            end,
 8666:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) end,
 8667:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8668:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8669: 
 8670: do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) ->
 8671:     ?P("begin"),
 8672:     Self         = self(),
 8673:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8674:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8675:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8676:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8677: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8678: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8679: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8680: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8681: 	 end,
 8682:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8683:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8684:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8685:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8686:     ?P("close socket"),
 8687:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8688:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8689:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8690:     ?P("done"),
 8691:     ok.
 8692: 
 8693: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8694:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8695: 
 8696: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8697:     receive
 8698: 	{'DOWN', ExpMon, ExpType, ExpSock, _Info} = Msg ->
 8699: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8700: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Msg]),
 8701: 	    exit(ok);
 8702: 
 8703: 	Any ->
 8704:             ExpMsg = {'DOWN', ExpMon, ExpType, ExpSock, '_Info'},
 8705: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8706: 	       "~n   ~p, Expected:"
 8707:                "~n   ~p", [Name, Any, ExpMsg]),
 8708: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any, ExpMsg})
 8709:     end.
 8710: 
 8711: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 8712:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 8713: 
 8714: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 8715:     receive
 8716: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 8717: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 8718:     end.
 8719: 
 8720: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 8721:     receive
 8722: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 8723: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 8724: 	    ok;
 8725: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 8726: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 8727: 	       "~n   ~p, Expected:"
 8728:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes, ExpRes]),
 8729: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes, ExpRes})
 8730:     end.
 8731: 
 8732: 
 8733: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8734: 
 8735: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8736: %% We create "many" listen socket(s), then spawns processes that create
 8737: %% monitors to them...
 8738: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8739:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8740:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8741:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8742:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8743:                             Addr;
 8744:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8745:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8746:                     end
 8747:            end,
 8748:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 8749:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8750:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8751: 
 8752: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 8753:     ?P("begin"),
 8754:     Self         = self(),
 8755:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8756:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 8757:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8758:     {ok, LSock2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8759:     {ok, LSock3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8760:     {ok, LSock4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8761:     {ok, LSock5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8762:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8763:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 8764: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 8765: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 8766: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 8767: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8768: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 8769: 	 end,
 8770:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8771:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([LSock1, LSock2, LSock3, LSock4, LSock5], F1),
 8772:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8773:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8774:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 8775:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8776:     gen_tcp:close(LSock2),
 8777:     gen_tcp:close(LSock3),
 8778:     gen_tcp:close(LSock4),
 8779:     gen_tcp:close(LSock5),
 8780:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8781:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8782:     ?P("done"),
 8783:     ok.
 8784: 
 8785: 
 8786: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 8787:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 8788: 
 8789: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 8790:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 8791:     exit(ok);
 8792: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 8793:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 8794:     receive
 8795: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 8796: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8797: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8798: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8799: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8800: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8801: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 8802: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 8803: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 8804: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 8805: 		{value, Value} ->
 8806: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 8807: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 8808: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 8809: 		false ->
 8810: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 8811: 	    end
 8812:     end.
 8813: 
 8814: 
 8815: 
 8816: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8817: 
 8818: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8819: %% We create a listen socket, then spawn client process(es) that create
 8820: %% monitors to it...
 8821: socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8822:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8823:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8824:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8825:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8826:                             Addr;
 8827:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8828:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8829:                     end
 8830:            end,
 8831:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config, Addr) end,
 8832:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8833:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8834: 
 8835: do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config, Addr) ->
 8836:     ?P("begin"),
 8837:     Self         = self(),
 8838:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8839:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8840:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 8841: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 8842: 	 end,
 8843:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 8844: 		 ?P("[~s] monitor socket", [Name]),
 8845: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8846: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8847: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8848: 	 end,
 8849:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 8850:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1, "client1"),
 8851:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(LSock1, F1, "client2"),
 8852:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(LSock1, F1, "client3"),
 8853:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(LSock1, F1, "client4"),
 8854:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(LSock1, F1, "client5"),
 8855:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 8856:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 8857:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 8858:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 8859:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 8860:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 8861:     ?P("close socket"),
 8862:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8863:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 8864:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8865:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 8866:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 8867:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 8868:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 8869:     ?P("done"),
 8870:     ok.
 8871: 
 8872: 
 8873: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8874: 
 8875: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8876: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8877: %% monitors to it...
 8878: socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8879:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8880:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8881:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8882:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8883:                             Addr;
 8884:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8885:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8886:                     end
 8887:            end,
 8888:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config, Addr) end,
 8889:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8890:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8891: 
 8892: do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config, Addr) ->
 8893:     ?P("begin"),
 8894:     Self         = self(),
 8895:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8896:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8897:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8898:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8899: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8900: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8901: 		 ?P("[client] sleep some"),
 8902: 		 ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8903: 		 ?P("[client] cancel (socket) monitor"),
 8904: 		 inet:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 8905: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 8906: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8907: 		 sm_await_no_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8908: 	 end,
 8909:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8910:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8911:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8912:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8913:     ?P("close socket"),
 8914:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8915:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8916:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8917:     ?P("done"),
 8918:     ok.
 8919: 
 8920: 
 8921: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8922:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8923: 
 8924: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8925:     receive
 8926: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 8927: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 8928: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 8929: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 8930: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8931: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8932: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8933: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8934: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 8935: 
 8936: 	Any ->
 8937: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8938: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 8939: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 8940: 
 8941:     after 1000 ->
 8942: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 8943: 	    exit(ok)
 8944:     end.
 8945: 
 8946: 
 8947: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8948: 
 8949: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8950: %% Spawn a process that creates a (listen) socket, then spawns processes
 8951: %% that create monitors to it...
 8952: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8953:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8954:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8955:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8956:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8957:                             Addr;
 8958:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8959:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8960:                     end
 8961:            end,
 8962:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) end,
 8963:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8964:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8965: 
 8966: do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) ->
 8967:     ?P("begin"),
 8968:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8969:     Self         = self(),
 8970:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 8971: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 8972: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 8973: 			      {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8974: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket to ctrl"),
 8975: 			      Self ! {socket, L},
 8976: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 8977: 			      receive
 8978: 				  {Self, die} ->
 8979: 				      exit(normal)
 8980: 			      end
 8981: 		      end),
 8982:     LSock1 = receive
 8983: 		 {socket, L} ->
 8984: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 8985: 		     L;
 8986: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 8987: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 8988: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 8989: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 8990: 	     end,
 8991:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8992:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8993: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8994: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8995: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8996: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8997: 	 end,
 8998:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8999:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 9000:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9001:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9002:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9003:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9004:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 9005:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9006:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9007:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9008:     ?P("done"),
 9009:     ok.
 9010: 
 9011: 
 9012: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9013: 
 9014: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9015: %% Spawn a process that creates "many" (listen) socket(s), then spawns
 9016: %% a process that create monitors to them...
 9017: 
 9018: socket_monitor2_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9019:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9020:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9021:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9022:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9023:                             Addr;
 9024:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9025:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9026:                     end
 9027:            end,
 9028:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 9029:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9030:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9031: 
 9032: do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 9033:     ?P("begin"),
 9034:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9035:     Self         = self(),
 9036:     ?P("spawn owner"),
 9037:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9038: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9039: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 9040: 			      {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9041: 			      {ok, L2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9042: 			      {ok, L3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9043: 			      {ok, L4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9044: 			      {ok, L5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9045: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket(s) to ctrl"),
 9046: 			      Self ! {socket, [L1, L2, L3, L4, L5]},
 9047: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 9048: 			      receive
 9049: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9050: 				      exit(normal)
 9051: 			      end
 9052: 		      end),
 9053:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),
 9054:     LSocks = receive
 9055: 		 {socket, Socks} ->
 9056: 		     ?P("received socket(s) from owner"),
 9057: 		     Socks;
 9058: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9059: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 9060: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9061: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9062: 	     end,
 9063:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 9064:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 9065: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 9066: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 9067: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 9068: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 9069: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9070: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 9071: 	 end,
 9072:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9073:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSocks, F1),
 9074:     ?P("await client ready"),
 9075:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9076:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9077:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9078:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 9079:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9080:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9081:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9082:     ?P("done"),
 9083:     ok.
 9084:

 9098:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9099:                     end

 9102:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9103:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).

 9105: do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config, Addr) ->
 9106:     ?P("begin"),
 9107:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9108:     Self         = self(),
 9109:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9110: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9111: 			      {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9112: 			      Self ! {socket, L},

 9114: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9115: 				      exit(normal)
 9116: 			      end
 9117: 		      end),

 9119: 		 {socket, L} ->
 9120: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),

 9122: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9123: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "

 9126: 	     end,

 9128: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 9129: 	 end,

 9131: 		 ?P("[~s] create monitor", [Name]),

 9135: 	 end,

 9137:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1, "client1"),
 9138:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(LSock1, F1, "client2"),
 9139:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(LSock1, F1, "client3"),
 9140:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(LSock1, F1, "client4"),
 9141:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(LSock1, F1, "client5"),
 9142:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 9143:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 9144:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 9145:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 9146:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 9147:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 9148:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9149:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9150:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 9151:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9152:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 9153:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9154:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 9155:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 9156:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 9157:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 9158:     ?P("done"),
 9159:     ok.

 9164: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9165: %% Spawn a process that creates a (listen) socket, then spawns (client)
 9166: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 9167: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9168:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9169:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9170:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9171:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9172:                             Addr;
 9173:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9174:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9175:                     end
 9176:            end,
 9177:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) end,
 9178:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9179:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9180: 
 9181: do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) ->
 9182:     ?P("begin"),
 9183: 
 9184:     Self = self(),
 9185: 
 9186:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9187:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9188: 
 9189:     ?P("try get (created) listen socket info"),
 9190:     try inet:info(L) of
 9191: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 9192: 	    ?P("(created) Listen socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 9193: 	OBadInfo ->
 9194: 	    ?P("(created) listen socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 9195: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9196: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 9197:     catch
 9198: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 9199: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) listen socket info: "
 9200: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9201: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9202: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 9203: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9204: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 9205:     end,
 9206: 
 9207:     ?P("try close (listen) socket"),
 9208:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 9209: 
 9210:     ?P("try get (closed) listen socket info"),
 9211:     try inet:info(L) of
 9212: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 9213: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9214: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9215: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 9216: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9217: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9218: 	CBadInfo ->
 9219: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 9220: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 9221:     catch
 9222: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 9223: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) listen socket info: "
 9224: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9225: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9226: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 9227: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9228: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 9229:     end,
 9230: 
 9231:     ?P("done"),
 9232:     ok.
 9233: 
 9234: 
 9235: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9236: 
 9237: %% Check that we can connect with the option 'bind_to_device'
 9238: %% and the inet_backend option set to socket.
 9239: %% The value types *where* mutually exclusive:
 9240: %% prim_inet: binary()
 9241: %% socket:    string()
 9242: otp_18357(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9243:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 9244:     Cond = fun() ->
 9245:                    is_socket_supported(),
 9246:                    has_support_sock_bindtodevice()
 9247:            end,
 9248:     Pre  = fun() ->
 9249:                    case ?LIB:which_local_host_info(inet) of
 9250:                        {ok, [#{name := Name, addr := Addr}|_]} ->
 9251:                            ?P("~w:pre -> local host info:"
 9252:                               "~n   (IF) Name: ~p"
 9253:                               "~n   (IF) Addr: ~p",
 9254:                               [?FUNCTION_NAME, Name, Addr]),
 9255:                            #{name => Name, addr => Addr};
 9256:                        {error, Reason} ->
 9257:                            {skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Reason])}
 9258:                    end
 9259:            end,
 9260:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18357(State) end,
 9261:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9262:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 9263: 
 9264: do_otp_18357(#{name := Name, addr := Addr}) ->
 9265:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9266:     {ok, L}      = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ifaddr, Addr}]),
 9267:     {ok, PortNo} = inet:port(L),
 9268: 
 9269:     ?P("try connect (with bind-to-device)"),
 9270:     C = case gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNo,
 9271:                              [{inet_backend,   socket},
 9272:                               {bind_to_device, list_to_binary(Name)}]) of
 9273:             {ok, CSock} ->
 9274:                 CSock;
 9275:             {error, eperm = Reason} ->
 9276:                 ?P("Failed connecting, ~p, skipping", [Reason]),
 9277:                 (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9278:                 skip(Reason)
 9279:         end,
 9280: 
 9281:     ?P("try accept"),
 9282:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 9283: 
 9284:     ?P("cleanup"),
 9285:     (catch gen_tcp:close(C)),
 9286:     (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
 9287:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9288: 
 9289:     ?P("done"),
 9290:     ok.
 9291:

 9295: otp_18883(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9296:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(10)),
 9297:     Cond = fun() ->
 9298:                    is_socket_supported(),
 9299:                    is_linux()
 9300:            end,
 9301:     Pre  = fun() -> undefined end,
 9302:     Case = fun(_) -> do_otp_18883() end,
 9303:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9304:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 9305: 
 9306: do_otp_18883() ->
 9307:     Opts = [{inet_backend, socket},
 9308:             {debug, true},
 9309:             {active, false},
 9310:             {reuseaddr, true},
 9311:             {raw, 1, 15, <<1:32/native>>}],
 9312:     
 9313:     ?P("Create first listen socket"),
 9314:     {ok, L1}   = gen_tcp:listen(0, Opts),
 9315:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L1),
 9316: 
 9317:     ?P("Create second listen socket with the same port number as first: ~w",
 9318:        [Port]),
 9319:     {ok, L2}   = gen_tcp:listen(Port, Opts),
 9320: 
 9321:     ?P("success - cleanup"),
 9322:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L1)),
 9323:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L2)),
 9324: 
 9325:     ?P("done"),
 9326:     ok.

 9329: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9330: 
 9331: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9332: otp_18707(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9333:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9334:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9335:             fun() ->
 9336:                     %% We are not actually trying to make a connection...
 9337:                     is_socket_supported(),
 9338:                     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
 9339:                         true ->
 9340:                             case ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config) of
 9341:                                 socket ->
 9342:                                     ok;
 9343:                                 Backend ->
 9344:                                     ?SKIPT({backend, Backend})
 9345:                             end;
 9346:                         _ ->
 9347:                             ok
 9348:                     end
 9349:             end,
 9350:             fun() -> do_otp_18707(Config) end).
 9351: 
 9352: do_otp_18707(_Config) ->
 9353:     ?P("begin"),
 9354: 
 9355:     try gen_tcp:connect(#{port   => 80,
 9356:                           addr   => {127, 0, 0, 1},
 9357:                           family => inet},
 9358:                         [{inet_backend, socket}]) of
 9359:         {ok, Sock} ->
 9360:             %% Since we do not know what is going on
 9361:             %% on the machines we run the tests, this
 9362:             %% call "might" actually succeed...
 9363:             ?P("(expected) connect success"),
 9364:             gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 9365:             ok;
 9366:         {error, _Reason} ->
 9367:             ?P("expected failure: "
 9368:                "~n   ~p", [_Reason]),
 9369:             ok
 9370:     catch
 9371:         C:E:S ->
 9372:             ?P("unexpected failure: "
 9373:                "~n   C: ~p"
 9374:                "~n   E: ~p"
 9375:                "~n   S: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 9376:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, C, E, S})
 9377:     end,
 9378: 
 9379:     ?P("done"),
 9380:     ok.

 9382: 
 9383: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9384: 
 9385: is_windows() ->
 9386:     case os:type() of
 9387:         {win32, nt} ->
 9388:             true;
 9389:         _ ->
 9390:             false
 9391:     end.
 9392: 
 9393: is_linux() ->
 9394:     is_unix(linux, "Linux").
 9395: 
 9396: is_unix(Name, PlatformStr) ->
 9397:     is_platform(unix, Name, PlatformStr).
 9398: 
 9399: is_platform(Family, Name, PlatformStr)
 9400:   when is_atom(Family) andalso
 9401:        is_atom(Name) andalso
 9402:        is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 9403:     case os:type() of
 9404:         {Family, Name} ->
 9405:             ok;
 9406:         _ ->
 9407:             skip("Require " ++ PlatformStr)
 9408:     end.
 9409:   
 9410: 
 9411: is_socket_supported() ->
 9412:     try socket:info() of
 9413:         #{} ->
 9414:             ok
 9415:     catch
 9416:         error : notsup ->
 9417:             skip("esock not supported");
 9418:         error : undef ->
 9419:             skip("esock not configured")
 9420:     end.
 9421: 
 9422: has_support_sock_priority() ->
 9423:     has_support_socket_option_sock(priority).
 9424: 
 9425: has_support_sock_bindtodevice() ->
 9426:     has_support_socket_option_sock(bindtodevice).
 9427: 
 9428: has_support_socket_option_sock(Opt) ->
 9429:     has_support_socket_option(socket, Opt).
 9430: 
 9431: has_support_socket_option(Level, Option) ->
 9432:     case socket:is_supported(options, Level, Option) of
 9433:         true ->
 9434:             ok;
 9435:         false ->
 9436:             skip(?F("Not Supported: ~w option ~w", [Level, Option]))
 9437:     end.
 9438: 
 9439: 
 9440: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9441: 
 9442: skip(Reason) ->
 9443:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 9444: 
 9445: 
 9446: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9447: 
 9448: messages() ->
 9449:     pi(messages).
 9450: 
 9451: links() ->
 9452:     pi(links).
 9453: 
 9454: monitors() ->
 9455:     pi(monitors).
 9456: 
 9457: pi(Pid) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 9458:     process_info(Pid);
 9459: 
 9460: pi(Item) ->
 9461:     pi(self(), Item).
 9462: 
 9463: pi(Pid, Item) ->
 9464:     {Item, Val} = process_info(Pid, Item),
 9465:     Val.    
 9466:

 9468: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9469: 
 9470: send_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9471:     ?F("Send failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9472: 
 9473: connect_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9474:     ?F("Connect failed: ~w", [Reason]).
